item.title: Options
item.description: 3. Options 3.1 Option Basic Two Types of Options: Call (right buy) and Put (right sell). American Options can exercise at any time up to and including expiration. A. Moneyness A call option is in-the-money if the asset price is greater than the exercise price (i.e., if it would be worth something exercised). A put option is in-the-money if the asset price is less than the exercise price (i.e., if it would be worth something exercised).
